GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Chlamydia
Chlamydia is passed on through unprotected sex and is particularly common in sexually active teenagers and young adults.
Gonorrhoea
Gonorrhoea is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by bacteria called Neisseria gonorrhoeae or gonococcus. It used to be known as "the clap".
Pubic Lice
Pubic lice (sometimes called crabs) are tiny insects that live on coarse human body hair, such as pubic hair.
Syphilis
Syphilis is a bacterial infection that's usually caught by having sex with someone who's infected.
HIV
Human Immunodeficiency Virus damages the cells in the immune system and weakens the ability to fight everyday infections and disease.
Genital herpes
Genital herpes is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) passed on through vaginal, anal and oral sex.
Scabies
Scabies is an itchy skin condition caused by tiny parasites. Itâ€™s passed through skin-to-skin contact, usually during sex.
HPV
HPV is the name of a very common group of viruses. They do not cause any problems in most people, but some types can cause genital warts or cancer.
Molluscum contagiosum
Molluscum contagiosum is an infection that causes small bumps on the skin. It can be contracted through touching infected skin, including during sex.
Trichomoniasis
Trichomoniasis is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by a tiny parasite called Trichomonas vaginalis (TV).
Bacterial vaginosis
Bacterial vaginosis (BV) is an imbalance of bacteria in the vagina and a common cause of unusual vaginal discharge.
Cervicitis
Cervicitis is an inflammation of the cervix commonly caused by sexually transmitted infections.
Mycoplasma genitalium
Mycoplasma genitalium is also known as MG or Mgen. It's a sexually transmitted bacterium that infects the urinary and genital tracts of men and women.
Mycoplasma genitalium
Mycoplasma genitalium is also known as MG or Mgen. It's a sexually transmitted bacterium that infects the urinary and genital tracts of men and women.
PrEP
The patient is eligable for PrEP, a drug used to prevent HIV.
Urethritis
Urethritis is inflammation of the urethra, usually caused by an infection.
Erectile dysfunction
Erectile dysfunction (ED) is the inability to get or keep an erection firm enough to have sexual intercourse.
Hyperspermia
Hyperspermia is a condition in which a male has an abnormally large ejaculate (or semen) volume, and is generally defined in humans when the ejaculate is above 5.5 ml.
Hypospermia
Hypospermia is a condition in which a male has an unusually low ejaculate (or semen) volume, less than 1.5 mL.
Epididymitis
Epididymitis is where a tube (the epididymis) at the back of the testicles becomes swollen and painful.
Balanitis
Balanitis is a skin irritation on the head of the penis that can affect men and boys.
Prostatitis
Prostatitis is inflammation (swelling) of the prostate gland.
